results.title: Metformin promotes angiogenesis and functional recovery in aged mice after spinal cord injury by adenosine monophosphate-activated protein kinase/endothelial nitric oxide synthase pathway
results.text_hl: We found that aging hindered the recovery of neurological function and the formation of blood vessels in the @<m>DISEASE_Spinal_Cord_Diseases</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D013118 @@@spinal cord@@@. Treatment with @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@ promoted @<m>DISEASE_Spinal_Cord_Diseases</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D013118 @@@spinal cord@@@ microvascular endothelial cell migration and blood vessel formation in vitro.

citations.NLM: Zhao JY, Sheng XL, Li CJ, Qin T, He RD, Dai GY, Cao Y, Lu HB, Duan CY, Hu JZ. Metformin promotes angiogenesis and functional recovery in aged mice after spinal cord injury by adenosine monophosphate-activated protein kinase/endothelial nitric oxide synthase pathway Neural Regen Res. 2023 Jul;18(7):1553-1562. results.title: Anti-inflammatory effects of Metformin improve the neuropathic pain and locomotor activity in spinal cord injured rats: introduction of an alternative therapy.
results.text_hl: Anti-@DISEASE_Inflammation @DISEASE_MESH:D007249 @@@inflammatory@@@ effects of @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@Metformin@@@ improve the @DISEASE_Neuralgia @DISEASE_MESH:D009437 @@@neuropathic pain@@@ and locomotor activity in @<m>DISEASE_Spinal_Cord_Diseases</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D013118 @@@spinal cord injured@@@ @SPECIES_10116 @@@rats@@@: introduction of an alternative therapy.

results.title: Metformin Protects Against Spinal Cord Injury by Regulating Autophagy via the mTOR Signaling Pathway.
results.text_hl: Nissl staining revealed that @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@ also increased the number of surviving neurons in the @<m>DISEASE_Spinal_Cord_Diseases</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D013118 @@@spinal cord lesion@@@.
